title: Amber Davies Talks About Working Hard on Strictly Come Dancing
summary: The Strictly Come Dancing final is coming soon, and three celebrities are competing to win the glitterball trophy. Amber Davies, one of the finalists, has been talking about how hard she has worked. Some people think she has an advantage because she has been in musicals and on Dancing on Ice, but Amber says she has worked just as hard as the other finalists. The show is presented by Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman, who are leaving after this series. Other finalists include George Clarke and Karen Carney, who is a footballer and feels proud to be in the final. The final will be on TV on Saturday.

background_read: Strictly Come Dancing is a popular TV show where celebrities learn to dance with professional partners. They compete each week, and viewers vote for their favorites. The final is the last episode where the winner is chosen. Sometimes, people debate if some contestants have more experience, but everyone works hard to improve their dancing skills.
Article_Structure: WHO: Amber Davies, George Clarke, Karen Carney, Tess Daly, Claudia Winkleman
WHAT: The Strictly Come Dancing final is happening, and Amber Davies discusses working hard despite criticism.
WHERE: On TV (BBC One and iPlayer) and at a press conference.
WHY: To report on the final and Amber's response to people saying she has an advantage.

perspectives.description: She believes she has worked just as hard as the other finalists, even with her experience.
They think Amber's background in musicals and ice dancing gives her an unfair advantage.
